page.title: 19CUSTOMS IN GREAT WENHAM
page.content: An area next to threeways is known by locals as 'Dodge City' and another area next to Corner Farm on the Wenham Road is known as 'Silver City'.This is because Army accommodation huts were sited there during the 2nd World War to house American Airmen serving at Raydon Airfield. The huts were taken over by the civilian population after the war until they could be rehoused.Many were evacuees from London.These names of the areas of Wenham are still present in the current doctor's notes.
